wifindus.eye

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • wifindus.eye.Location
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Location
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An immutable, serializable packet of data describing an object's location. Values within are represented with Java's boxing Double type to allow for incomplete location data (as reporting devices may not fully report their location, or may omit information).
    Author:
    Mark 'marzer' Gillard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.Double latitude,
        java.lang.Double longitude,
        java.lang.Double accuracy,
        java.lang.Double altitude)
        Creates a new Location object.
        Parameters:
        latitude - The latitude of the coordinate. Use null for 'no data'.
        longitude - The longitude of the coordinate. Use null for 'no data'.
        accuracy - The radius of 68% confidence as reported by the device. Use null for 'no data'.
        altitude - The altitude of of the coordinate, as meters above sea level. Use null for 'no data'.

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.Double latitude,
        java.lang.Double longitude,
        java.lang.Double accuracy)
        Creates a new Location object.
        Parameters:
        latitude - The latitude of the coordinate. Use null for 'no data'.
        longitude - The longitude of the coordinate. Use null for 'no data'.
        accuracy - The radius of 68% confidence as reported by the device. Use null for 'no data'.

        longitude - The longitude of the coordinate. Use null for 'no data'.

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Tests if this is an entirely empty Location structure.
        Returns:
        TRUE if all members of this Location are NULL, FALSE otherwise.

      • getLatitude

        public final java.lang.Double getLatitude()
        Returns the latitude of the location
        Returns:
        A value between -90.0 and 90.0 (inclusive), or null (for no data).

      • getLongitude

        public final java.lang.Double getLongitude()
        Returns the longitude of the location
        Returns:
        A value between -180.0 and 180.0 (inclusive), or null (for no data).

      • getAccuracy

        public final java.lang.Double getAccuracy()
        Returns the radius of 68% confidence of the horizontal positioning
        Returns:
        A value between 0 and 9999.9999 (inclusive), or null (for no data).

      • getAltitude

        public final java.lang.Double getAltitude()
        Returns the altitude of the location as meters above sea level.
        Returns:
        A value greater than or equal to 0.0, or null (for no data).
